TEXT ORDER. IT HEREBY IS ORDERED that,https://dcecf.psc.uscourts.gov/doc1/17311050251,3,Defendant's Motion for an Order Granting James S. Urban's Admission to this district pro hac vice is GRANTED, subject to the prompt payment of the required fee. SO ORDERED. Issued by the Hon. William M. Skretny on 7/24/2007. (MEAL) (Entered: 07/27/2007)

TEXT ORDER. The,https://dcecf.psc.uscourts.gov/doc1/1731409216,15,Stipulation setting forth a submission schedule on the,https://dcecf.psc.uscourts.gov/doc1/1730396046,13,Defendants' Motion for Judgment on the Pleadings is HEREBY SO ORDERED. Response is due on or before 9/21/2007. Reply is due on or before 10/5/2007. Oral Argument will be scheduled if necessary after review of the submissions. SO ORDERED. Issued by the Hon. William M. Skretny on 7/30/2007. (MEAL) (Entered: 07/31/2007)

TEXT ORDER. IT HEREBY IS ORDERED that the,https://dcecf.psc.uscourts.gov/doc1/17301083487,20,Plaintiffs' Motion for an Extension of Time to File a Response to,https://dcecf.psc.uscourts.gov/doc1/1730396046,13,Defendants' Motion for Judgment on the Pleadings is GRANTED. Plaintiffs' Response is now due by 9/28/2007. Defendants' Reply is now due 10/12/2007. This motion is granted on stipulation, without affidavit, THIS TIME ONLY. SO ORDERED. Issued by the Hon. William M. Skretny on 9/24/2007. (MEAL) (Entered: 09/26/2007)

Joint MOTION for Hearing,in Form of Status Conference,by Barbara Caya, Dresser Industries, Inc., Consolidated Retirement Plan, Halliburton Retirement Plan, Halliburton, Inc., Kathy Joy Kirkendall, Bonnie Seth, Wesley Snyder. (Attachments: #,https://dcecf.psc.uscourts.gov/doc1/17312056116,1,Certificate of Service)(Urban, James) (Entered: 05/03/2011)

TEXT ORDER REASSIGNING CASE. IT HEREBY IS ORDERED that this case is TRANSFERRED to the Hon. John T. Curtin for all further proceedings. SO ORDERED. Issued by William M. Skretny, Chief Judge U.S.D.C. on 6/7/2011. (MEAL) (Entered: 06/07/2011)

DECISION AND ORDER granting Defendants',https://dcecf.psc.uscourts.gov/doc1/17301016816,11,Motion for Judgment on the Pleadings with respect to Count I of the Complaint seeking declaratory judgment, and Count II seeking relief pursuant to ERISA sections 204 and 208. Defendants' Motion is converted to a summary judgment motion with respect to Counts III and IV, and that Motion is granted for failure to exhaust the administrative claims procedures established by the relevant Plan. Plaintiffs' Complaint is dismissed in its entirety and with prejudice. The parties' joint,https://dcecf.psc.uscourts.gov/doc1/17302056115,25,Motion for a status conference is denied as moot. The Clerk is directed to enter judgment in favor of Defendants and to close this case. Signed by Hon. John T. Curtin on 6/8/2011. (JEC) (Entered: 06/09/2011)

JUDGMENT in favor of Dresser Industries, Inc., Consolidated Retirement Plan, Halliburton Retirement Plan, Halliburton, Inc. against Barbara Caya, Bonnie Seth, Kathy Joy Kirkendall, Wesley Snyder. Signed by the Clerk of the Court on 6/10/2011. (DLC) (Entered: 06/10/2011)

NOTICE OF APPEAL as to,https://dcecf.psc.uscourts.gov/doc1/17312086435,28,Judgment by Barbara Caya, Kathy Joy Kirkendall, Bonnie Seth, Wesley Snyder. Filing fee paid $455.00, Receipt #024726. (DLC) (Entered: 07/06/2011)

Remark: Pursuant to Local Rule 12.1 of the US Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, Forms C and D must be completed within 14 days after the filing of a notice of appeal. Forms C & D attached. (DLC) (Entered: 07/06/2011)
